title: Maple Leafs and Oilers win big in hockey games
snippets: Matthews gets 1st goal since return in Maple Leafs win against Penguins NHL.com
The Toronto Maple Leafs had seven players record two points vs. The Pittsburgh Penguins in a 7-2 beat down, including Auston Matthews, who scored his 10th goal of the season.
Ryan Nugent-Hopkins and Leon Draisaitl each recorded a goal and an assist, Stuart Skinner stopped all 26 shots he faced, and the Edmonton Oilers shut out the Seattle Kraken 4-0.
Anze Kopitar opened the scoring, Anton Forsberg made 19 saves and Adrian Kempe buried the game-winning goal in overtime to lift the Los Angeles Kings over the Vancouver Canucks 2-1.
Brock Nelson scored two goals and added two assist and Gabriel Landeskog also found the back of the net twice as the Colorado Avalanche routed the Montreal Canadiens 7-2 at Ball Arena on Saturday.
Nino Niederreiter buried a pair of goals, Cole Perfetti scored the game-winning goal and Eric Comrie made 20 saves to help the Winnipeg Jets beat the Nashville Predators 5-2.
Brandon Hagel potted a pair of goals and Nikita Kucherov had three helpers as the Tampa Bay Lightning handled the New York Rangers 4-1.

Tomas Hertl scored twice, Mitch Marner picked up a goal and an assist, and Carl Lindbom recorded his first win of the season with 18 saves to lead the Vegas Golden Knights to a 4-3 win over the San Jose Sharks.
Josh Doan scored the game-tying goal in the third period, Noah Ostlund sealed the Sabres’ win in the shootout, and Buffalo earned a 3-2 vicotry over the Minnesota Wild.
Dylan Holloway scored the lone goal of the game while Joel Hofer stopped all 18 shots he saw as the St. Louis Blues beat the Utah Mammoth 1-0.

NHL Highlights: Sabres 3, Wild 2 (SO)
NHL Highlights: Blues 1, Mammoth 0
summary: The Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins 7-2, with Auston Matthews scoring his 10th goal of the season. The Edmonton Oilers shut out the Seattle Kraken 4-0, while the Los Angeles Kings edged the Vancouver Canucks 2-1 in overtime. Other notable wins include the Colorado Avalanche over the Montreal Canadiens 7-2, Winnipeg Jets over Nashville Predators 5-2, and Tampa Bay Lightning over New York Rangers 4-1.

title: China factory activity shrinks again in November
snippets: China's factory activity shrinks again in November, services cool Reuters

HONG KONG (AP) — China’s factory activity contracted for the eighth straight month in November, according to an official survey on Sunday, underscoring challenges for the country’s economy despite the U.S.-China trade truce. The official manufacturing purchasing managers index rose slightly to 49.2

summary: China’s factory activity contracted for the eighth consecutive month in November, with the official manufacturing purchasing managers index (PMI) rising slightly to 49.2 but remaining below the 50-point mark that separates growth from contraction. The services sector also showed signs of cooling, highlighting ongoing economic challenges despite recent trade developments.
